RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TURNPIKE BOB was away alertly to vie for the early lead three wide, then set a pressured pace two wide on the turn, then had a long drive with KEEPING IT COUNTRY through the lane and prevailed gamely to prove best. KEEPING IT COUNTRY was bumped at the start, vied for the early lead on the inside, then pressed the winner on the turn, made a bid off the turn and dueled the final furlong but missed. TIZ SPEEDY broke in at the start, bumping a foe, reserved early, came five wide into the lane and closed well. LILTONYTWOPHONES chased the early pace four wide, made a three wide bid on the turn but flattened out. UNCLE DAR vied for the early lead in between rivals, steadied by the half mile marker, then chased the pace three wide but had no kick. SUNSHINE HARRY was settled early, came four wide into the lane and had no rally. Jockey OBJECTION the rider on number four TIZ SPEEDY against the number three KEEPING IT COUNTRY for alleged interference at the gate, the STEWARDS did not allow the OBJECTION and the race was left as is.

ENTRY.NAME: Liltonytwophones
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 4 wide, bid 3 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Keeping It Country
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, vied inside, pressed inside, bid inside, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Speedy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in, bumped foe, reserved, came 5 wide, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Dar
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between horses, steadied 1/2, 3 wide turn, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Turnpike Bob
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied 3 wide, set pace 2 wide turn, dueled,prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Sunshine Harry
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 4 wide, no rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 121 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I KNOW MAP stalked the early pace and made a three wide bid on the turn, then had a long drive with LAWYER JOHN and prevailed late to prove best. LAWYER JOHN was away alertly to set the early pace ond on the inside, then was headed and had a long drive with the winner nearing the furlong marker, dug in gamely but missed late. PRETORIAN GOLD was well placed early on the inside, angled out leaving the turn for aim but had no late kick, bested rest. BELLS RUN was reserved early, inside on the turn and had no rally. EAST AURORA was settled early, three wide on the turn and had no rally. MAX BARLEY was off a step slow and failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Pretorian Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, angled out upper, no kick, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: I Know Map
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, long drive, prevailed, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Bells Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, saved ground turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Max Barley
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: East Aurora
ENTRY.OWNER: Zent June and Short Straw Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3 wide turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Lawyer John
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, long drive, dug in gamely, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I ONCE STOOD ALONE stalked the early pace and made a three wide bid leaving the turn, drew clear in the final furlong to prove best under a drive. SUMMER ASH was reserved early, saved ground on the turn, cut corner leaving the turn and finished well up the inside to gain the place award. ONEHANDSOMEDUDE chased the early pace and was three wide on the turn, came five wide into the lane and had a mild late kick but needed more. AMICALOLA FALLS was away alertly and was well placed on the inside, eased out nearing the quarter pole and came four wide into the lane but had no kick. HELLMAN bobbled slightly at the start, settled early, came five wide into the lane and then had a belated rally. ECLIPTICALS BEAR set the pace while racing in the two path, then was headed nearing the furlong marker and weakened. TRIPLE TITOS chased the pace on the inside and steadied slightly nearing the seven sixteenths, then weakened in the drive. DORSODURO chased the pace in between rivals and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Triple Titos
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, steadied slightly 7/16, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Dorsoduro
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Hellman
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, settled, came 5 wide, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Onehandsomedude
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, came 5 wide, mild kick, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Amicalola Falls
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, well placed inside, eased out, came 4 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Ash
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, saved ground turn, cut corner, rallied inside

ENTRY.NAME: I Once Stood Alone
ENTRY.OWNER: Brooks Gerald E and Hess Jr Carl L
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, drew clear final 1/8, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Eclipticals Bear
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2 wide, headed 1/8, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 24. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARGING LION stalked the pace on the outside, made a three wide bid on the turn to duel for command by the quarter pole, then drew away in the final furlong to prove best, driving. I SEE THE STARS was well placed early from between rivals, made a two wide bid on the turn with the winner, dueled with that rival off the turn but could not match strides with that rival late, second best. VIOLENT PASS was away alertly to set the early pace, headed on the turn and then drifted out in the drive and saved the show award. POCOPSON STATION was off a step slow, raced on the inside early, eased out on the turn and came five wide into the lane and had no rally. LIL GREEN MACHINE tracked the pace on the inside and weakened. STANHOPE broke in the air at the start, then made a three wide move on the turn but was eased the final furlong, walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Lil Green Machine
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Pocopson Station
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, inside, came 5 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: I See the Stars
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed between horses, bid 2 wide, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Stanhope
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air, 3 wide move turn, eased 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Charging Lion
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace outside, bid 3 wide, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Violent Pass
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace inside, headed turn, drifted out, held sho

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOUGHTON SHUFFLE was off a step slow but quickly moved up to stalk the pace three wide, made a three wide bid on the turn to duel for command by the quarter pole, then drew away in the final furlong under left handed crop urging. BOOK RUNNER was reserved early, came four wide into the lane and finished well late to gain the place award. BROKENHEARTED pressed the early pace on the inside, then fell off the pace and shifted out nearing the quarter pole to make a four wide bid off the turn but flattened out, lost place late, bested rest. GOTTA HAVE HEART broke outwardly at the start, chased the pace four wide and weakened. NECCO set a pressured pace early two wide, then dueled for the lead on the inside by the quarter pole and then weakened in the drive. SEARCH FOR HOPE was settled on the inside and had no response.

ENTRY.NAME: Search for Hope
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Martin Kaci
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Brokenhearted
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed inside, shift out, bid 4 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Houghton Shuffle
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, moved up quickly, bid 3 wide, drew away, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Book Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came 4 wide upper stretch, late rally, got 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Necco
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace 2 wide, dueled inside 1/4, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Gotta Have Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Martin Kaci
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outwardly, chased pace 4 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 24. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLIND SIGHT was settled early, made a four wide move on the turn, then had a long drive with DANCE A LITTLE JIG and out gamed that foe to prevail late under a drive. DANCE A LITTLE JIG was wel rated two wide, made a three wide move on the turn, then dueled with the winner through the lane but was out-kicked late. JUSTIN TIME stalked the pace three wide, then went up to press the pace on the backstretch, made a two wide bid on the turn to gain a short lead but weakened. ALWAJD set the pace on the inside, then dueled for the lead on the inside and then gave way in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Alwajd
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, dueled inside, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Dance a Little Jig
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated 2 wide, 3 wide move turn, long drive, out-kicked

ENTRY.NAME: Blind Sight
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, 4 wide move, long drive, prevailed, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Justin Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid 2 wide turn, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 24. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAINBOW TROUT was four wide into the first turn, then stalked the pace on the outside, made a three wide bid on the turn and then slowly edged clear in the furlong grounds to prove best, driving. MIKEY'S JEWEL prompted the pace three wide, then was two wide on the far turn, angled out leaving the furlong marker and finished well late to be gaining, second best. SERENE WARRIOR set a slow pace on the inside, then was headed nearing the furlong marker, dug in but faded late, bested rest. BAMBOO GARDEN chased the pace on the inside, eased out nearing the half mile pole, then was four wide on the turn and weakened in the drive. ARCTICA was allowed to settle while being tough to handle early, then failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Bamboo Garden
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, 4 wide 2nd turn, came 4 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Arctica
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Rainbow Trout
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, stalked pace outside, bid 3 wide, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Serene Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: set slow pace inside, headed 1/8, late fade, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Mikey's Jewel
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 3 wide, angled out 1/8, gaining late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR RONNY ALAN stalked the early pace three wide while hard held, made a two wide bid in hand by the quarter pole, then slowly edged clear in the furlong grounds to prove best under a drive. WICKED IRISHMAN set the pace on the inside and was headed nearing the quarter pole, dug in gamely in the drive but was out-kicked late, second best. HOLY CITY was well placed on the inside, swung out three wide leaving the turn and had no kick, bested rest. BRANTLEYS BIG GUN was settled early, saved ground on the turn and cut the corner leaving the turn and improved position late. OVER THE BORDER was settled early, four wide by the quarter pole and came five wide into the lane and was empty. LOOKIN BACK LUCKY steadied leaving the chute, then made a three wide move on the turn and came four wide into the lane and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Holy City
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, swung out 3 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Irishman
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, dug in gamely stretch, out-kicked

ENTRY.NAME: Our Ronny Alan
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, bid in hand 2 wide, edged clear late,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Brantleys Big Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, cut corner, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Lookin Back Lucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied chute, 3 wide move turn, stopped stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Over the Border
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide 1/4 pole, came 5 wide, empty,
